description: Minor Material Amendment (pursuant to S73 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990) to: planning permission 2011/0734 dated 30/03/2012 for demolition of the existing buildings comprising of 412 dwellings and development of a residential led mixed use scheme of replacement buildings comprising of up to 884 dwellings with business and retail floorspace; reserved matters approval 2012/2584 for details of Access, Appearance, Landscaping, Layout and Scale for buildings between 1 and 8-storeys in height, comprising of 209 new residential units together with a new community centre, energy centre, and retail floorspace, dated 8/11/2012. Amendments comprise: Variation of conditions 1 (development in accordance with approved plans), 5 (maximum floorspace limit), 6 (maximum floorspace in each development zone) , 7 (maximum type of floorspace), 44 (residential internal noise levels), and 55.1 (plant noise from the energy centre), in order to facilitate enlargement of building envelopes in some instances closer to neighbouring existing buildings such as Atrium Apartments); revised reserved matters for blocks C2 and E to incorporate design changes to facades, plan layout, incorporation of sprinkler systems, change to unit size mix; change to the energy strategy to incorporate Air Source Heat Pumps within the energy centre; discharge conditions 27 (drainage), 28 (energy centre details), 32 (landscaping), 34 (daylight / sunlight assessment), and 46 (ecology report).
decision_conditions: <p>Prior to the commencement of any phase of the development adjoining the waterway, an assessment of potential biodiversity impacts of any proposed canal access and or canal / walkway shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved and shall be fully implemented before the premises are first occupied.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To conserve and enhance the wildlife value of the canal in line with Core Strategy Policies 27 and 28 and the Mayors Biodiversity Strategy.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>52 Development Zone D wind assessment</p><p>Prior to the commencement of any development within Development Zone D hereby approved, a detailed wind assessment shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The wind assessment shall provide details of the wind micro-climate conditions at building entrances and to relevant locations of open space and amenity space adjacent to the development and in the vicinity of the site and set out any mitigation measures to be required. Any mitigation measures shall be implemented in full and retained as such, unless otherwise in writing by the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that the wind micro-climate does not adversely impact on the amenity of the immediate surroundings.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>53 Signage for retail units</p><p>Prior to the commencement of any phase of development which contains a use falling within Use Class A1, A2, A3, A4, or A5 (as defined by the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (as amended)) details of the design of the shopfront and location, type and size of signage shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall not be carried out other than in accordance with the details thus approved, unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the development is satisfactory.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>54 restaurant / takeaway kitchen extract details</p><p>No Use Class A3 or A5 use shall commence on site until detailed plans and specification of the appearance of and the equipment comprising an extract ventilation system which shall include measures to alleviate noise, vibration, fumes and odours (and incorporating active carbon filters, silencer(s), and anti vibration mountings where necessary) have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. After the system has been approved, it shall be installed in accordance with the approved plans and specification before any Use Class A3 or A5 use is implemented, and shall thereafter be permanently maintained in accordance with the approved specification.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the interest of adjoining residential amenity&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>55 Noise from energy centre</p><p>i) The rating level of the noise emitted from the energy centre on the site shall be limited to a level that is 10dB below the existing representative background sound level shall at any time, or 30 dBA, whichever is higher. The noise levels shall be determined at the façade of any noise sensitive property. The measurements and assessments shall be made according to BS4142:2014.</p><p><br></p><p>ii) Development of Zone E shall not commence until details of a scheme of noise reduction and/or insulation complying with paragraph (i) of this condition have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.</p><p><br></p><p>iii) The residential part of Zone E shall not be occupied until the scheme approved pursuant to paragraph (ii) of this condition has been implemented in its entirety. Thereafter, the scheme shall be maintained in perpetuity unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the interest of adjoining residential amenity&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>56 Design details of energy centre</p><p>Prior to the commencement of Development Zone E, details of the design of the Energy Centre shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall not be carried out other than in accordance with the details as approved, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure the development is in accordance with the particulars of the application hereby approved and to ensure the efficient provision of energy and heat to all parts of the development.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>57 Details of bus layover and turnaround space</p><p>Prior to the commencement of of any development within Zone C full details of a replacement bus layover and bus turnaround scheme (including any temporary arrangements during construction) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The scheme as approved shall be implemented in full and retained as such prior to the commencement of any development within Zone C, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that suitable bus layover and turning facilities are continuously provided in this vicinity in order to support the efficient operation of the bus network and in accordance with London Plan policy 6.2 and the Land for Transport SPG.&nbsp;</p><div><br></div>

<p>The remediation scheme shall be implemented in accordance with the approved timetable of works. Within 3 months of the completion of measures identified in the approved remediation scheme, a validation report (that demonstrates the effectiveness of the remediation carried out) must be submitted to the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON (conditions 39 to 42): To protect the end user(s) of the development, any adjacent land user(s) and the environment from contamination in line with Planning Policy Statement 23&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>42 Unexpected contamination&nbsp;</p><p>In the event that contamination is found at any time when carrying out the approved development that was not previously identified it must be reported in writing within 7 days to the Local Planning Authority and once the Local Planning Authority has identified the part of the site affected by the unexpected contamination development must be halted on that part of the site. An assessment must be undertaken in accordance with the requirements of condition 39, and where remediation is necessary a remediation scheme, together with a timetable for its implementation, must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority in accordance with the requirements of condition 40. The measures in the approved remediation scheme must then be implemented in accordance with the approved timetable. Following completion of measures identified in the approved remediation scheme a validation report must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority in accordance with condition 41.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON (conditions 39 to 42): To protect the end user(s) of the development, any adjacent land user(s) and the environment from contamination in line with Planning Policy Statement 23&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>43 Biodiverse / green roofs</p><p>Prior to the commencement of any phase of development, full details of a biodiverse, substrate-based extensive green roof (of variable depth between 80mm and 150mm), to include a detailed maintenance plan, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved and shall be fully implemented before the premises are first occupied.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To enhance the character and ecology of the development, to provide undisturbed refuges for wildlife, to promote sustainable urban drainage, and to enhance the performance and efficiency of the proposed building.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>44 Sound levels within new dwellings</p><p>All residential premises shall be designed in accordance with BS8233:1999 'Sound insulation and noise reduction for buildings-Code of Practice' to attain the following internal noise levels: Criterion Typical situations Design range LAeq, T&nbsp;</p><p>Good resting conditions&nbsp;</p><p>Living rooms 35 dB (day: T =16 hours 07:00-23:00) Good sleeping conditions&nbsp;</p><p>Bedrooms 30 dB (night: T = 8 hours 23:00-7:00)&nbsp;</p><p>LAmax 45 dB (night 23:00-07:00)&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>Prior to the occupation of any phase of development, a test shall be carried out to show the standard of sound insulation required has been met and the results shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in writing.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that the occupiers and users of the proposed development do not suffer a loss of amenity by reason of excess noise from environmental and transportation sources.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>45 District wide heat network</p><p>Prior to the commencement of any phase of development details of the design and location of the relevant part of the District-Wide Heat Network shall be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall not be carried out other than in accordance with the details as approved, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure the development is in accordance with the particulars of the application hereby approved and to ensure the efficient provision of energy and heat to all parts of the development.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>46 Bat Survey</p><p>Prior to the commencement of any phase of development (with the exception of phase C2 / E where details have been submitted with application 2021/1406) details of a bat survey, prepared in line with the recommendations of the Bat Survey of Ecology Consulting dated June 2011, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure the development does not impact on protected species.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>47 Waterway wall method statements</p><p>Prior to the commencement of any phase of the development adjoining the waterway hereby approved a survey of the condition of the waterway wall, and a method statement and schedule of the repairs identified shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Any heritage features and materials identified by the survey shall be made available for inspection by British Waterways and where appropriate, preserved in situ or reclaimed and reused elsewhere on site or on a nearby waterway wall. The repair works identified shall be carried out in accordance with the method statement and repairs schedule by a date to be agreed in the repairs schedule.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the interest of the structural integrity of the waterway wall, waterway heritage, navigational safety and visual amenity.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>48 Waterway risk assessment</p><p>Prior to the commencement of any phase of the development adjoining the waterway a Risk Assessment and Method Statement outlining all works to be carried out adjacent to the water shall be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, in consultation with British Waterways.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the interest of the structural integrity of the waterway wall, waterway heritage, navigational safety and visual amenity.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>49 Waterway landscaping scheme</p><p>Prior to the commencement of any phase of the development adjoining the waterway full details of a specific waterways landscaping scheme shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, in consultation with British Waterways. The landscaping scheme should include reference to plant species types, surface treatments, fences and walls, any signage and information boards together with the means of on-going maintenance for a five year period. The approved landscaping scheme shall be implemented by the first planting scheme after the development commences.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the interest of preserving open views to and from the canal, the living environment for future residents and the canal setting.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>50 CCTV adjacent to the waterway</p><p>Prior to the commencement of any phase of the development adjoining the waterway, full details of any proposed lighting and CCTV scheme shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, in consultation with British Waterways. The approved lighting and CCTV scheme should be implemented prior to first occupation of the relevant part of the development.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the interest of crime prevention, ecology, visual amenity and the canal setting.&nbsp;</p><div><br></div>

<p>Prior to the commencement of any phase of development, a detailed remediation scheme to bring the site to a condition suitable for the intended use by removing unacceptable risks to human health, buildings and other property and the natural and historical environment shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The scheme must include all works to be undertaken, proposed remediation objectives and remediation criteria, an appraisal of remedial options, and proposal of the preferred option(s), and a timetable of works and site management procedures. The scheme must ensure that the site will not qualify as contaminated land under Part 2A of the Environmental Protection Act 1990 in relation to the intended use of the land after remediation.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON (conditions 39 to 42): To protect the end user(s) of the development, any adjacent land user(s) and the environment from contamination in line with Planning Policy Statement 23&nbsp;</p><div><br></div>

<p>Prior to the commencement of any phase of development, an assessment of the nature and extent of contamination shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. This assessment must be undertaken by a competent person, and shall assess any contamination on the site, whether or not it originates on the site. Moreover, it must include:&nbsp;</p><p>(i) a survey of the extent, scale and nature of contamination;</p><p>(ii) an assessment of the potential risks to: human health, property (existing or proposed) including buildings, crops, livestock, pets, woodland and service lines and pipes, adjoining land, groundwaters and surface waters, ecological systems, archaeological sites and ancient monuments.&nbsp;</p><div><br></div>

<p>Prior to the commencement of any phase of development, details of secure bicycle storage facilities, including layout, stand type and spacing, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Such details as approved shall be implemented prior to the occupation of the development and shall thereafter be retained, unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp;</p><p>REASON: To ensure that adequate provision for the safe and secure storage off bicycles is made for occupants and visitors.&nbsp;</p><div><br></div>

<p>Prior to the commencement of any phase of development, a detailed layout of any parking area and spaces, including to basements, undercroft or on-street, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. As well as the general layout of the car parking spaces details shall also be provided of: the demarcation of spaces; any signs; any disabled car parking spaces (and to be conveniently located in relation to wheelchair accessible or wheelchair adaptation standard units); electric charging points; the detailed design of any entrance ramps (if within a basement), and the detailed design of any entrance gates (or similar), access controls, or lighting (if within basement or undercroft). Such details as approved shall be implemented prior to the occupation of the development and shall thereafter be retained, unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the interests of orderly and satisfactory parking provisions being made on the site to ensure that the proposed development does not prejudice the free flow of traffic or public safety along the adjoining highway.&nbsp;</p><div><br></div>

<p>Prior to the commencement of any phase of development, full details of the arrangements for storage for refuse and recycling areas shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Such details as approved shall be implemented prior to the occupation of the development and shall thereafter be retained, unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To protect the amenity of future residents and to ensure that there is adequate provision for the hygienic and convenient storage of refuse and recycling.&nbsp;</p><div><br></div>

<p>Prior to the commencement of any phase of development, details of the design of all playable space, play equipment and street furniture shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Such details as approved shall be implemented prior to the occupation of the development and shall thereafter be retained, unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the interest of the visual amenity of the development and wider area, and to meet the needs of future residents.&nbsp;</p><div><br></div>

<p>Prior to the commencement of any phase of development (with the exception of phase C2 / E, where a daylight sunlight report for this phase has been submitted with application 2021/1406), a daylight and sunlight report, detailing the level of daylight and sunlight received by all new residential units, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that the design and layout of the residential units allows for adequate daylight and sunlight for the amenity of future occupiers.&nbsp;</p><div><br></div>

<p>Prior to the commencement of any phase of development, a tree survey detailing trees to be transplanted and retained, including the methodology for transplanting trees and measures to protect retained trees during demolition and construction, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall not be carried out other than in accordance with the details thus approved, unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that any risk of damage to trees during construction is minimised.&nbsp;</p><div><br></div>

<p>Prior to the commencement of any phase of development (with the exception of phase C2 / E which shall be in accordance with the details submitted with application 2021/1406), a hard and soft landscaping scheme illustrated on detailed drawings, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Details shall include: all trees and other planting showing location, species, type of stock, numbers of trees/plants, and areas to be seeded or turfed. All landscaping in accordance with the scheme, when approved, shall be carried out within a period of twelve months from the date on which the development of the site commences or shall be carried out in the first planting (and seeding) season following completion of the development, and shall be maintained to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority for a period of ten years, such maintenance to include the replacement of any plants that die, or are severely damaged, seriously diseased, or removed.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To enhance the character, appearance and ecology of the development and contribution to green infrastructure.&nbsp;</p><div><br></div>

<p>Prior to the commencement of the construction of the above ground structure of any phase of development full details and samples of all ground surface materials and details of any fences, gates of other boundary treatment shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall not be carried out other than in accordance with the details thus approved, unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that all external areas of the development are of a satisfactory appearance&nbsp;</p><div><br></div>

<p>Prior to the commencement of the construction of the above ground structure of any phase of development full details and samples of all external materials including any window frames, doors, cladding panels, brick work, and/or balconies shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall not be carried out other than in accordance with the details as approved, unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the development is satisfactory.&nbsp;</p><div><br></div>

<p>Prior to the commencement of any phase of the development a Biodiversity Enhancement Plan, including a strategy for habitat enhancements in respect of birds and bat roosting enhancements undertaken in consultation with an suitably qualified ecologist following all necessary further bat surveys has been undertaken shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To enhance the character and ecology of the development in line with Hackney policy and PPS 9.</p><div><br></div>

<p>The energy centre design shall be installed in full accordance with the Energy Strategy by Max Fordham dated 29/04/2021, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure the development is in accordance with the particulars of the application hereby approved and to ensure the efficient provision of energy and heat to all parts of the development.&nbsp;</p><div><br></div>

<p>Prior to commencement of any phase (unless previously approved by discharge of application, with details for phase C2 / E approved as part of application 2021/1406) the following in respect of the relevant phase shall be submitted and approved by the local planning authority:</p><p>1. A scheme to maximise the use of sustainable drainage of the site in accordance with the London Plan hierarchy including the following:</p><p>a. Detailed examination of all roof surfaces to maximise green and brown roofs which in any case should not be less than 50% of the total roof area.&nbsp;</p><p>b. Detailed examination of all ground /podium surfaces to maximise landscaped areas throughout the development which in any case should not be less than 50% of the courtyard area.&nbsp;</p><p>c. Detailed examination of all paved areas to maximise permeable surfacing of which in any case should not be less than those areas shown to be pedestrianised and for car parking.</p><p>d. Detailed examination of the ground and context of the site to maximise use of techniques for infiltrating surface water to ground.</p><p>2. An overall drainage scheme including the following mitigation measures detailed:</p><p>a. The phasing of development in conjunction with a drainage design that limits surface water run off for rainfall events up to the 1 in 100 year cc rainfall event to greenfield rates with an acceptable minimum of 5.0l/s from each development zones.&nbsp;</p><p>b. A drainage design showing containment of surface water to prevent surface flooding up to the 1 in 30 year cc critical rainfall event&nbsp;</p><p>c. Demonstration by use of drawings and details that surface water runoff can be contained on site to a 1in 100 year cc critical rainfall event and subsequently satisfactorily discharged.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To prevent flooding on site and elsewhere by ensuring the satisfactory storage/disposal of surface water from the site. To ensure surface water runoff is managed maximising the use of sustainable drainage systems and principles and to reduce the volume of run off from the developed site. This condition is supported by PPS25 Para F6 and London Plan policy 5.13. For development zones I&nbsp; and Public Realm consideration of greenfield run off from the 1 in 1 year and 1 in 30 year rainfall events should also be examined&nbsp;</p><div><br></div>

<p>Prior to the commencement of the development hereby approved a Site Waste Management Plan, detailing the reduction and recycling of demolition and construction waste, The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved and shall be fully implemented before the premises are first occupied.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that waste from demolition and construction is minimised as par as possible.&nbsp;</p><div><br></div>

<p>Prior to the commencement of the development hereby approved a feasibility study shall be carried out to assess the potential for moving freight by water during the construction cycle (waste and bulk materials) and following occupation of the development (waste and recyclates). The use of waterborne transport shall be maximised during the construction of the development unless the above assessment demonstrates that such use of the canal is not physically or economically feasible.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To encourage the use of the canal for transporting waste and bulk materials in accordance with Blue Ribbon Network Policies of the London Plan.&nbsp;</p><div><br></div>

<p>Prior to the commencement of the development hereby approved, a lighting strategy to include details of all lighting to external areas shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure: an appropriate lighting environment is provided to all external areas; light spill is avoided and residential amenity protected, and; a satisfactory appearance of the site.&nbsp;</p><div><br></div>

<p>Prior to the occupation of the development hereby approved, a public realm and landscape management plan, to include long term design objectives, management responsibilities and maintenance schedules for all hard and soft landscape areas, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The landscape management plan shall be carried out as approved unless otherwise approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure a satisfactory appearance of the development in maintained.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p>

<p>No soil stacks, soil vent pipes, flues, ductwork or any other pipework shall be fixed to the street-facing elevations of the buildings hereby approved, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is satisfactory and does not detract from the character and visual amenity of the area.</p><div><br></div>

<p>Prior to the occupation of 449 residential units an Energy Centre shall be provided, and all completed Development Zones shall be connected to the Energy Centre by a District-wide Heat Network and all subsequently completed Development Zones shall be connected to the Energy Centre by a District-wide Heat Network, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure the development is in accordance with the particulars of the application hereby approved and to ensure the efficient provision of energy and heat to all parts of the development.&nbsp;</p><div><br></div>

<p>The development hereby approved shall be designed and constructed to meet the minimum design and build standards for security outlined in the Secured by Design (SBD) standards, unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that the potential for crime and the perception of crime is reduced.&nbsp;</p><div><br></div>

<p>All residential accommodation will be provided with private amenity space in the form of a balcony, terrace and/or private garden of at least the following size: 1-bedroom 5 sq.m 2-bedroom 6 sq.m 3-bedroom 8 sq.m 4-bedroom 9 sq.m unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that adequate private amenity space is provided to all new residential units.&nbsp;</p><div><br></div>

<p>At least 10% of all units shall be built to wheelchair accessible standards or capable of easy adaptation to wheelchair accessible standards, unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that adequate accommodation is made for people with disabilities as part of the development.&nbsp;</p><div><br></div>

<p>Reserved Matters Applications for each phase shall demonstrate that all of the residential units hereby approved will be designed and constructed as far as practicable to meet the standards contained within the Interim London Housing Design Guide published by the Mayor of London.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that reasonable living conditions for future occupiers.&nbsp;</p><div><br></div>

<p>All residential units shall be designed and constructed to achieve Lifetime Homes Standards, unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that all residential accommodation is built to a good standard.</p><div><br></div>

<p>At least 20% of all car parking spaces shall have electrical charging points, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that a reasonable minimum level of electrical charging points for electrical cars are provided.&nbsp;</p><div><br></div>

<p>At least 26 disabled car parking spaces shall be provided, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure a socially inclusive and sustainable development and that a reasonable minimum level of parking spaces is provided for use by people with disabilities.</p><div><br></div>

<p>No more than 0.3 car parking spaces per residential units (including disabled car parking spaces) shall be provided, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that adequate car parking is provided for future residents.&nbsp;</p><div><br></div>

<p>The financial and professional services (Use Class A2) hereby approved shall not be used for the purpose of a betting office, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the interest of the general amenity of the area.&nbsp;</p><div><br></div>

<p>The development shall include at least 250 sqm of floorspace (GEA) for use as a community centre (Use Class D1), unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that adequate community facilities are provided as part of the development for future residents</p><div><br></div>

<p>The development shall include at least 400 sqm of floorspace (GEA) for use as Retail (Use Class A1), Financial and professional services (Use Class A2), Restaurants and cafe (Use Class A3), Drinking establishments (Use Class A4), Hot food takeaways (Use Class A5), unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. At least 80% of all of the Use Class A floorspace shall be used only for Retail (Use Class A1), unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that adequate retail and other service facilities are provided as part of the development for future residents, and to enhance the vitality and viability of any retail floorspace provided.</p><div><br></div>

<font face="Liberation Serif"><span style="font-size: 16px; white-space: pre-wrap;">Within each Development Zone hereby approved a playable space of at least the area detailed within the following table shall be provided (Table 3), unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority: Table 3: Development Zone Minimum Area of Playable Space (sq.m) 
A 43
C 356
D 114
E 307
F 400
G 480 
H 542 
I 704 
J 635 

REASON: To ensure that adequate provision is made as part of the development for playable space for children aged from 0 to 11.</span></font>&nbsp;&nbsp;<p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="background-color: transparent; font-family: &quot;Liberation Serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; white-space: pre-wrap;"> </span><br></p>

<p>The residential accommodation hereby approved shall not exceed 884 units overall, unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure the development is in accordance with the regulatory plans and particulars of the application</p><div><br></div>

<p>The amount of floorspace of each land use hereby approved shall not exceed the amount detailed within the following table (Table 2), unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority: Table 2: Land Use or Use Class Maximum Floorspace GIA (sq.m) / Maximum Floorspace GEA (sq.m)&nbsp;</p><p>Residential (Use Class C3) 80630 / 91112&nbsp;</p><p>Business workspace (Use Class B1)* 1010 / 1140&nbsp;</p><p>Mixed Use (Use Class A1, A2, A3, A4, A5, D1, D2) 950 / 1075&nbsp;</p><p>Parking, Plant and Storage 6439 / 7275&nbsp;</p><p>Energy Centre 520 / 585* Only in place of Residential (Use Class C3)&nbsp;</p><p>Total 89549 / 101187</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure the development is in accordance with the regulatory plans&nbsp;</p><div><br></div>

<p>The amount of floorspace in each respective Development Zone (as indicated on the Regulatory Plans hereby approved) shall not exceed the amount detailed within the following table (Table 1), unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority:&nbsp;</p><p>Table 1: Development Zone Maximum Floorspace GIA (sq.m) / Maximum Floorspace GEA (sq.m)&nbsp;</p><p>A 6323 / 7145&nbsp;</p><p>C 5720 / 6582&nbsp;</p><p>D 19980 (16980*) / 22578 (19188*)&nbsp;</p><p>E 7004 / 7735&nbsp;</p><p>F 9530 / 10835</p><p>G 8238 / 9310&nbsp;</p><p>H 10130 / 11447</p><p>I 12371 / 13979&nbsp;</p><p>J 12726 (9726*) / 14380 (10990*) * Maximum Area without basement car parking&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure the development is in accordance with the regulatory plans and particulars of the application.&nbsp;</p><div><br></div>

<p>The total amount of floorspace developed shall not exceed 89,549 sq,m (Gross Internal Area) and 101,187 sq.m (Gross External Area).&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure the development is in accordance with the regulatory plans and particulars of the application.</p><div><br></div>

<p>Prior to commencement of development a Phasing Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The phasing of the development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved phasing plan, unless an alternative phasing plan is first submitted to the Local Planning Authority with an assessment of any effects, including any different impacts on the environment, and that alternative plan and assessment is approved by the Local Planning Authority pursuant to this condition.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that the proposed development is carried out in accordance with the planning permission and scheme of works, and to avoid any detriment to the comprehensive development and to amenity and any harm to the interests of highway safety that may be caused by any phase remaining uncompleted.&nbsp;</p><div><br></div>

<p>Applications for approval of the Reserved Matters of the first phase of development shall be made to the Local Planning Authority not later than THREE years from 30/03/2012. Applications for approval of the Reserve Matters of the final phase of development shall be made to the Local Planning Authority not later than FIFTEEN years from the 30/03/2012. The first phase and final phase of the development hereby permitted shall begin not later than TWO years from the date of approval of the last of the reserved matters to be approved, or, in the case of approval on different dates, the final approval of the last such matter to be approved.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To comply with Section 92 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.&nbsp;</p><div><br></div>

<p>Details of the (i) Access, (ii) Appearance, (iii) Landscaping, (iv) Layout and (v) Scale (as defined by the Town and Country Planning (General Development Procedure) Order 1995 (as amended) (hereinafter called "the Reserved Matters") for development zones F, G, H, I and J (reserved matters for phase C2 and E are approved as part of this application) of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before each phase of development commences. Each phase of development shall be carried in accordance with the Reserved Matters as approved, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that the Local Authority is satisfied with the details of the proposed development.</p><div><br></div>
